hints.content:
Every coin has a different value.

Coin name | Picture | Value
- | - | -
Penny | ![](https://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-images/d0799f515398b1f48cb0baa7bdc8d0c12e26c70c.png) | $1¢$
Nickel | ![](https://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-images/f6c7ae82228012be92b624995809aeabc8e95370.png) | $5¢$
Dime | ![](https://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-images/2017369b968caa0c88d046bddf2406665c8cd34d.png) | $10¢$
Quarter | ![](https://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-images/1cc5cb6f4c779c49984f5a63a58443ce0ca96ff9.png) | $25¢$

Let's label the value of each set of coins and find the total.

###$9$ nickels and $2$ pennies

$\begin{align}
&\underbrace{\goldE{5¢} + \goldE{5¢} +\goldE{5¢} + \goldE{5¢} 
 +\goldE{5¢} + \goldE{5¢} +\goldE{5¢} + \goldE{5¢} + \goldE{5¢}}_{\goldE{9}{\text{ nickels}}} +\underbrace{ \maroonD{1¢}+\maroonD{1¢}}_{\maroonD{2}{\text{ pennies}}}\\\\
&\underbrace{\goldE{45¢}}_{\goldE{9}{\text{ nickels}}} +\underbrace{\maroonD{2¢}}_{\maroonD{2}{\text{ pennies}}}=47¢
\end{align}$

This set of coins has a value of $47¢$, so it is **not** equal to $92¢$.

###$3$ quarters, $1$ dime, and $2$ pennies

$\begin{align}
&\underbrace{\blueE{25¢} +\blueE{25¢}+\blueE{25¢}}_{\blueE{3}{\text{ quarters}}} +\underbrace{\purpleD{10¢}}_{\purpleD{1}{\text{ dime}}} +\underbrace{ \maroonD{1¢}+\maroonD{1¢}}_{\maroonD{2}{\text{ pennies}}}\\\\
&\underbrace{\blueE{75¢}}_{\blueE{3}{\text{ quarters}}}  +\underbrace{\purpleD{10¢}}_{\purpleD{1}{\text{ dime}}}+\underbrace{\maroonD{2¢}}_{\goldE{2}{\text{ pennies}}}=87¢
\end{align}$

This set of coins has a value of $87¢$, so it is **not** equal to $92¢$.

###$3$ quarters, $1$ dime, $1$ nickel, and $2$ pennies

$\begin{align}
&\underbrace{\blueE{25¢} +\blueE{25¢}+\blueE{25¢}}_{\blueE{3}{\text{ quarters}}} +\underbrace{\purpleD{10¢}}_{\purpleD{1}{\text{ dime}}} 
 +\underbrace{\goldE{5¢}}_{\goldE{1}{\text{ nickel}}}+\underbrace{ \maroonD{1¢}+\maroonD{1¢}}_{\maroonD{2}{\text{ pennies}}}\\\\
&\underbrace{\blueE{75¢}}_{\blueE{3}{\text{ quarters}}}  +\underbrace{\purpleD{10¢}}_{\purpleD{1}{\text{ dime}}} +\underbrace{\goldE{5¢}}_{\goldE{1}{\text{ nickel}}}+\underbrace{\maroonD{2¢}}_{\goldE{2}{\text{ pennies}}}=92¢
\end{align}$

This set of coins has a value of $92¢$, so it **is** equal to Abha's amount of money.

Abha could have this set of coins:

$3$ quarters, $1$ dime, $1$ nickel, and $2$ pennies

question.content:
Abha has $92¢$.

**Which set of coins could Abha have?**

[[☃ radio 1]]
